text: I am from New Orleans and I must say that this place was very good...the food was seasoned to perfection....the customer service was great....the food is made to order so please be patient....it was worth the wait!

Granny's was a nice place to get out of the 110 degree heat. I enjoyed a nice glass of ice water, and reruns on the TV while my order was being prepared. 

The place looks like a hole in the wall on the outside. Pretty spacious inside to my surprise.

It takes a good 15 to 20 minutes to prepare your order, so don't come here in a hurry! 

Yummy greens cooked with turkey. Very tasty!

The chicken is part of Louisiana Fried Chicken chain. If you like that chicken chain's taste you will be right at home at Granny's.

Clothes for sale here too.

Yep I'm definitely a new fan. Be back when I'm back in Vegas for sure!

In Vegas soul food restaurants can be hard to find and when you do they usually  don't last long. 
 I was in the mood for some good home style cooking and Granny's hit the spot.  I get the smothered chicken with rice and gravy and greens . The greens are the best!! The chicken is cooked just right. The reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the don't have banana pudding  . All n all friendly people good food and its conveniently located 2 blocks from where I live . I'll definitely keep going back for more
Jus to let yah'll kno, this place did indeed hav some tasty food...however, it was SHUT DOWN by HEALTH DEPT due to a D... So maybe they really did put their foot into it

So I've been craving some Greens & MAC .. Granny's Kitchen did not disappoint!  I used DOOR DASH to order & everything got here in a timely manner. I ordered the Special with 8 pieces of chicken & two sides... I also got roles. I couldn't resist ordering Peach Cobbler & wow was it tasty! Chicken was Spicy Crunchy & Succulent ! The Greens had just the right amount of salt & flavoring ! Mac & Cheese was the best I've had aside from homemade... I will definitely order through Door Dash again & I may just go take a trip there to try other things! I'm so happy I found Soul Food in Vegas ! Thanks Granny ..   you made me happy !
Eaten here twice. The BEST Louisiana style chicken! Ever! I recommend this to anyone who likes spicy food. Going to try the ribs next time. I will let you know!

We arrived into Vegas on a Sunday afternoon.  After driving down the Strip it was time to get something to eat.  We turned down Maryland Parkway and saw a sign for Granny's Kitchen.  We pulled in and what a gem we found!  You are greeted at the door by three staff members as soon as you enter.  After being seated we ordered one fried chicken and two fried catfish dinners.  Your meal comes with 2 sides and cornbread or rolls.  The catfish and the chicken were both cooked to perfection and the seasoning was just right!  The yams tasted like something your Grandma made on Thanksgiving with lots of love.  The Mac n' cheese was creamy and delicious and when you took a forkful the cheese was stringy!  The collard greens had smoked turkey in it and was full of favor.  We even drank the "pot liquor" from the bowl!!!  If you don't know what pot liquor is...you need to ask somebody!  LOL.  Also kudos to our waiter Xavier.  He took good care of us and was very polite.  We felt like we were down South because he kept saying "Yes Ma'am, No Ma'am".  He even remembered our names as we left. We highly recommend that if you feel like eating some soul food and having good service...stop by Granny's Kitchen.  You won't be disappointed.  Also on Sunday the prices are reduced!
The customer service was very poor. They forgot to give me  a spoon and napkin. The chicken wings were huge but wasn't fried well and the beans and rice was ok. I wish I had better service.

Not that there's anything wrong with M&Ms, but I was looking to switch things up a bit.  Came across this joint through a Yelp search.  It's not in the best location, so if safety is your concern, I'd suggest coming to this place when the sun is still shining.  I'd definitely stay away when the sun goes down.  The workers here were very friendly and inviting.  Dining room decor needs some updating, but the food is really good.

I was pumped to try a new soul food spot in town and right down the street from my job and house. I walked in and a gentleman comes from the kitchen wearing flip flops and dirty jeans. The girls in the kitchen were not wearing hair nets or gloves. They said it was going to be 20-25 minutes and it took 45 minutes which was most of my lunch break. As i was waiting i noticed there was a bug zapper hanging in the register area. I have been to many souls food restaurants and i always order either smothered chicken or smothered pork chops. I decided on the chicken here. Every other place that includes a bed of rice, the chicken on that and the drowned ( smothered ) in gravy. Here you have to order rice and gravy as a side and it is a very small portion. There was gravy on the chicken but i would hardly call it smothered. The mac and cheese was very good. The flavor of the chicken was ok. I thought the Louisiana hot sauce flavoring was a little too much but not bad. For the quality and amount of food, i would say it is a little too pricey. I most likely will not return. I wish them luck as they try to make it in the community and hopefully they make some improvements.

I ordered from Grubhub the catfish dinner with greens and yams. The Yams had literally 2 slices of yam inside! I've ordered here before delivery and pick up so I know they played me I'm soooooo mad! I paid $20 for an incomplete meal it's already not enough food for the price

If you like frilled chicken you will love it here. It's just a touch spicy but oh so good and tender. Orders are cooked when placed so be ready to wait if you are doing the carry out. Location is truly not the best but the staff and food are worth the trip.
Hidden gem. Everyone is friendly and makes you feel like you're family. Food is worth every dime!

First time going.  We were there 30 minutes after they opened on a Sunday morning.  They only sell chicken, fish, and pork chops. After we all decided what we wanted, we were told they had no pork chops.  Ok.  So we all got fried chicken.  The chicken was good, but spicy.  Upon leaving we saw signs by the register that said the chicken is spicy,  but the waitress should have told us. 
The mac n cheese was bomb and the yams were good. The corn bread was different. We had 5 orders with 4 orders of yams and they ran out of yams for one person in our party.  The sodas were flat. I gave it 4 stars because the food was good and at a good price. They just need to work on a few things.
If you're going here on a Sunday expecting them to still have their special don't they no longer have it. I gave them one star because the website clearly says they still have it.

We ordered delivery from here and it came within 40 minutes. It was some really yummy chicken, a little spicy but not to much. My husband got the hot wings and he said they was extremely spicy but still good. We also ordered the roni n cheese, which was really good to, reminds us of home cooking. The yams was sweet and delicious. Wish they had mashed potatoes and biscuits, but what they do have is really good.

Long story short. 100% disappointing. Not sure what's with all the hype about this place. I've tried on 3 different occasions to try this place; apparently they close 30 mins early even though they say they close at 8. The first two times they completely screwed up my order, I did not get what I ordered. When they finally got my order right, the food was absolutely terrible.

Love when I find a new soul food spot and everything here is on point. Corn bread has a nice fluffy and moist texture with the perfect amount of sweet you can taste with every bite. Fried chicken and fried pork chop cooked to perfection not too salty either just the right amount of everything. Mac n Cheese game is strong as F@*k and collard greens have that good homemade granny cookin that we all love.

Omg so let me tell y'all this food is A1. I'm from lbc, ca and been in Vegas for 6months looking for some food back home. Well, baby I've found it. Those ladies were in there doing their thang and my tummy is thankful. It's only 5mins from me, I will be back.

Being from the south it's hard to find good soul food like my granny made, but let me tell you this place does it, the food, the amazing service, and soulful environment took me home again. The fried chicken, collard greens, mac and cheese, fried catfish were all excellent can't wait to go back
keep sharing the love

The food is absolutely delicious! I don't mind the wait for hot fresh cooked southern food! The catfish is REAL catfish mot that swali junk other so-called soul food places use. The chicken strips are cut up REAL chicken breast.  It's the bomb! Greens, REAL mac n cheese with flavor. Gotta try it!

Out of respect for a new business, especially with a soul food model, I will give it 4 stars, even though the food and the experience was not 4 stars. 
Ordered a 2 piece chicken meal to-go. Informed that it would be 20-25 minutes, which I respect as it means the chicken is cooked to order. Arrived about 25 minutes later and ended up waiting another 7-10 minutes for my food. While waiting I was entertained with 2 African American women yelling at each other full throat in the back by the fashion section for a solid 5-7 minutes. My assumption was that they were employees/owners as none of the nice ladies behind the counter even flinched. Not an inviting environment for customers to say the least, even though I got a chuckle out of the absurdity of it. On to the food.
Fried Chicken-Great seasoning, nice size, WAY overcooked. Half the meat in the thigh was equivalent to jerky and maybe a quarter of the meat on the breast. Could have stayed in the pan for 3-4 minutes less and been perfect. 
Mac and Cheese- Very good. Better than most.
Green-Very good. Better than most. 
Dinner Roll-Store bought regular dinner roll
Service-Ladies behind the counter were very friendly and efficient. 
Price-$15 and change (without tip) is pricy for a 2 piece chicken meal with 2 sides and no drink.  (I upgraded to breast and thigh, but still) For some reason I find this across the board with Soul Food restaurants in general. Don't know what the philosophy is behind this, but it doesn't seem like a good business model. 
Will try it again before I give up on it, no excuse for WAY over fried foods.

I ordered the smothered pork chops,macaroni and cheese and greens and I can say it was pretty good and one of the best soul food places in lv that I have tried and the 3 people with me felt the same way.Thanks and keep it cookin
Omg you talking about good soul food this place was so good!!!!!! EVERYTHING WAS GOOD!!!!! Me & My Boyfriend really enjoyed OUR FOOD

Oh the flavor!!!!!! Oh the seasonings!!! We ordered a 16 piece with 2 large sides and 8 rolls. This has to be the best fried chicken I ever had. Super crispy, hot, juicy and flavorful. Not greasy at all. I went with the 16 piece  in fear of this being my first order. I was worried I might end up with little tiny legs and wings. This was not the case at all. These were good size pieces. The roni and cheese... what can I say... bangin!!!! The yams... bangin!!!! The taste, the quality someone is really cooking with love. I would love to order the sides for Thanksgiving or Christmas. I can't wait to try other things on the menu. Btw I ordered through Uber eats. The driver said it smelled so good he was going back to get dinner!! The food was piping hot too.

Food was great and the people working there were kind. A little bit of a wait but well worth it. I have not found anywhere close to comparrison as far as fried southern foods go. Eating here will make you never wanna go to kfc, popeyes, or churchs chicken again. The catfish was amazing too.

Terrible experience.  We ordered through Grub Hub for delivery.  The order was missing potato salad and peach cobbles.  We called the restaurant to advise of missing items & they said we had to order more food & they would throw our missing items in.  I'm sorry, why do I have to pay more to the items I already paid for??  They have us a new phone number to call, we call and guess what?  They refunded us for the missing items.  While grateful to be reimbursed, the point was to get the damn food.  By the way, the food was NOT that good.  Will never order or go here again.

I went to this place strictly for the Louisiana fried chicken.  $20 bucks for 20 pieces of mixed chicken and 12 rolls. Great deal.  If only it wasn't super super spicey I would have given 5 stars. I was sweating the entire time as I could feel my blood pressure explode, it's fried chicken so it's not there fault I guess lol.  They have thrifty ice cream which is always good too.

OMG this place is everything! It's a hole in the wall, mom and pop type place and the people are always friendly, attentive, and recognizable. I've been living at my new place for about two months now and I go there about once a week. It's across the street from the high-rise tower I live in and they are always quick to serve very good home cooking. The fried chicken is amazing and I love poppin in for a quick bite of side-dishes, which includes the typical "granny's" rice&beans, "granny's" collard greens w/smoked turkey, and "granny's" roni & cheese. -but in a full-size seated-style restaurant that's making IT HAPPEN in the 'ghetto'(it's not ghetto at all, but people from Vegas think it is...) where the population is abundant with fast food joint ALL over, they're consistently satisfying my taste buds and I end up having an overall great day! It's home cookin and the ribs may run out, so get it early! I prefer food to-go so I can eat and walk back to my building. Just kidding....I never walk anywhere!
My manager brought lunch, I suggested Granny's cause I seen it online.  The job place was satisfied!  We had Chicken, Greens, Mac and Cheese, and Cornbread.

So happy to find a place serving Louisiana Fried Chicken.  Being from So. Cal this is definitely one place I miss.  The food is cooked to order so it is very fresh.  The owner and staff are very friendly and welcoming.  I plan on taking my family and friends when they come to town.

I've seen this place several times.  A couple of days before, I popped in just to grab a menu.  So I see alot of chicken dinners on the menu.  Like so much you don't notice they have fish and pork chops.  When I walked in the girl at the counter was a sweetheart.  I guess she could tell I was a virgin (get your mind out of the gutter) a virgin at Granny's Kitchen.  Although I already saw the menu, she went over it with me.  So I thought I would be able to have a seat and eat.  But it took 25 to 30 min.  they do state that.  But If your not reading everything, you don't know that, and not only that, no refunds.  So if you see the sign later after you paid for you, your not getting your $$ back.   So  by the time my chicken came out, I had to get back on the road.  So I had to eat and drive, and that chicken was hot!  So I had to push that aside, and eat the mac n cheese.  OMG, this mac n cheese was off the chain!  You put your fork in, and pull it out, and the cheese is stringy from the bowl to your mouth!  OMG, I can just go and get me a couple of cup of mac n cheese.  I really couldn't get into the chicken.  It was just too much work trying to drive and eat.
I was si disappoint when i order my mean then tried to call back the phone was busy so my family mean was incomplete. And kinda ruined

The mac and cheese is unbelievably good- I could get so addicted to it- yum 
Green beans- perfect,  not over cooked like so many places do,  just right
Yams- like candy, delicious 
Hummingbird cake- wonderful!  What a great cake it is! Combo of banana and carrot cake is a great idea and it's a great dessert! 
Try this restaurant! It's top notch soul food! Mac and cheese may even be better than tc rib crib, and that's saying a lot.

My wife wanted to eat some "Soul Food" while we are in Las Vegas.  We were heading to North Las Vegas for another soul food restaurant, when she noticed on Yelp that this restaurant has 4.5 stars, and it was close proximity to where are staying. We were greeted by a friendly waitress, Jessica and we were seated. We ordered the food and it came within the 20 minutes that Ms. Jessica told us it would.  The presentation was very good. My wife had the fried catfish and I with the smothered chicken with two sides each, The entrees and the sides were very delicious and tasty. The owner, Ms. Shawna came by and introduced herself and welcomed us, we felt this was a classy gesture and we will certainly recommend this eating establishment to all our family and friends.
The prices were reasonable and the service was top notch.

I keep ordering from here. Their chicken has become an addiction. I don't even like anything spicy and I'll risk it all for their chicken  I usually order thru UberEATS or Postmates and I'll have the whole family at the door dying to grab the bag. Their yams are DELICIOUS but unfortunately they ran out when I ordered this time. But the Mac n Cheese made up for it and the seasoning for the fries are good too! My kids love it and they are very picky lol. I have spread the word about their food and my job will soon be ordering keep up the good work!
Its my birthday and i wanted fried chicken. I am sure glad i came here. Perfectly seasoned chicken, collard greens and mac & cheese.
